pullRequest.body:
Replace Submodule.quotient.mk with Submodule.mkQ as much as possible as it have better composition property and more direct lemmas, making it more similarly with `Ideal.Quotient.mk`
(except Algebra.Lie.Quotient.Basic for ones more familiar with these area)

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [1876864d0b](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/22269/commits/1876864d0bd180589f8d8eae0d60954f01631ebc)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ H1LequivOfIsTrivial_H1_π_apply_apply'`
`+ Quotient.induction_on'`
`+ Quotient.mkQ_smul_mkQ`
`+ Quotient.quot_hom_ext'`
`+ SModEq.def'`
`+ Submodule.toLocalizedQuotient'_mkQ`
`+ dualCopairing_apply'`
`+ dualPairing_apply'`
`+ dualQuotEquivDualAnnihilator_apply'`
`+ dualQuotEquivDualAnnihilator_symm_apply_mkQ`
`+ equivQuotTensor_naturality_mkQ`
`+ equivTensorQuot_naturality_mkQ`
`+ intSpanEquivQuotAddOrderOf_apply_self'`
`+ lTensor.inverse_apply'`
`+ lTensor.inverse_of_rightInverse_apply'`
`+ liftQSpanSingleton_apply_mkQ`
`+ liftQ_apply_mkQ`
`+ mapQ_apply_mkQ`
`+ map_apply_mkQ`
`+ mk''_eq_mkQ`
`+ mkQ_add`
`+ mkQ_eq`
`+ mkQ_eq'`
`+ mkQ_eq_mk`
`+ mkQ_eq_mkQ`
`+ mkQ_eq_zero`
`+ mkQ_neg`
`+ mkQ_quotientEquivOfIsCompl_apply`
`+ mkQ_smul`
`+ mkQ_sub`
`+ mkQ_zero`
`+ piQuotientLift_mkQ`
`+ quotAnnihilatorEquiv_apply'`
`+ quotDualCoannihilatorToDual_apply'`
`+ quotEquivOfEqBot_apply_mk_mkQ`
`+ quotEquivOfEqBot_symm_apply_mkQ`
`+ quotEquivOfEq_mkQ`
`+ quotIdealMapEquivTensorQuot_symm_tmul'`
`+ quotKerEquivRange_apply_mkQ`
`+ quotTensorEquivQuotSMul_symm_mkQ`
`+ quotTorsionOfEquivSpanSingleton_apply_mkQ`
`+ quot_mk_eq_mkQ`
`+ quotientEquiv.symm_apply_mkQ`
`+ quotientEquivOfIsCompl_apply_mkQ_coe`
`+ quotientEquivOfIsCompl_symm_apply'`
`+ quotientEquiv_apply_mkQ`
`+ quotientPiLift_mkQ`
`+ quotientTensorEquiv_apply_tmul_mkQ`
`+ quotientTensorEquiv_symm_apply_mkQ_tmul`
`+ quotientTensorQuotientEquiv_apply_tmul_mk_tmul_mkQ`
`+ quotientTensorQuotientEquiv_symm_apply_mkQ_tmul`
`+ reduceModIdeal_apply'`
`+ smul_mkQ`
`+ tensorQuotEquivQuotSMul_symm_mkQ`
`+ tensorQuotEquivQuotSMul_tmul_mkQ`
`+ tensorQuotientEquiv_apply_mkQ_tmul`
`+ tensorQuotientEquiv_symm_apply_tmul_mkQ`
`- piQuotientLift_mk`
`- quotientPiLift_mk`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>Increase in tech debt: (relative, absolute) = (1.00, 0.00)</summary>

|Current number|Change|Type|
|-:|:-:|:-|
|3350|1|porting notes|

Current commit [1876864d0b](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/1876864d0bd180589f8d8eae0d60954f01631ebc)
Reference commit [42e56d7453](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/42e56d74539f652e619ef870f2f518d51eb8342c)

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

Probably there are lemmas that should be deprecated or there are lemmas that I forgot to copy, as I haven't done big refactors before, please pin me so I can try to fix,  thanks.

BTW, as there is already `LieSubmodule.Quotient.mk'` the correct morphism, we probably don't need to care about the few uses in `LieSubmodule` related things.

Here are the [benchmark results](https://speed.lean-lang.org/mathlib4/run-detail/3a002360-5ae4-4f85-9fe8-d62d39f6e800) for commit 1876864d0bd180589f8d8eae0d60954f01631ebc.
There were [no significant changes](https://speed.lean-lang.org/mathlib4/compare/aa0a8484-f40d-4f6c-b569-86212c980c01/to/3a002360-5ae4-4f85-9fe8-d62d39f6e800) against commit 42e56d74539f652e619ef870f2f518d51eb8342c.

|File|Instructions|%|
|-|-:|:-:|
|`build`|+71.664⬝10⁹|(+0.04%)|
|`lint`|+6.920⬝10⁹|(+0.08%)|
|`Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.TensorProduct.Quotient`|+9.751⬝10⁹|(+14.20%)|
|`Mathlib.RingTheory.QuotSMulTop`|+8.45⬝10⁹|(+18.65%)|
|`Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.Dual`|+5.473⬝10⁹|(+1.29%)|
<details><summary>2 files, Instructions +4.0⬝10⁹</summary>

|File|Instructions|%|
|-|-:|:-:|
|`Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.TensorProduct.RightExactness`|+4.551⬝10⁹|(+4.72%)|
|`Mathlib.RingTheory.Ideal.Quotient.Operations`|+4.521⬝10⁹|(+2.95%)|
</details>

<details><summary>6 files, Instructions +2.0⬝10⁹</summary>

|File|Instructions|%|
|-|-:|:-:|
|`Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.Quotient.Defs`|+2.839⬝10⁹|(+20.77%)|
|`Mathlib.RingTheory.AdicCompletion.Functoriality`|+2.679⬝10⁹|(+2.89%)|
|`Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.Quotient.Basic`|+2.654⬝10⁹|(+4.83%)|

|`Mathlib.RingTheory.AdicCompletion.Exactness`|+2.85⬝10⁹|(+5.44%)|
</details>

<details><summary>9 files, Instructions +1.0⬝10⁹</summary>

|File|Instructions|%|
|-|-:|:-:|
|`Mathlib.RingTheory.AdicCompletion.Algebra`|+1.865⬝10⁹|(+2.07%)|
